uniChess

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniChess.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    An object holding a boardstate. Each Board holds an array of 64 Tiles, any of which can be occupied by a Piece.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Board.Tile 

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean reversed
      Sets the orientation of the string representation of the board.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board() 
      Board(Board other) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean cardinalLineOfSightClear(Location a, Location b)
      Returns whether or not a line of sight between two Locations is 'clear' (has no Pieces between them) in the up, down, left, right directions.
      boolean diagonalLineOfSightClear(Location a, Location b)
      Returns whether or not a line of sight between two Locations is 'clear' (has no Pieces between them) in the diagonal directions.
      Board.Tile[][] getBoardState()
      Returns a two-dimensional array of Tile objects wherein array[0][0] is the top left corner of the board and array[7][7] is the bottom right.
      Board.Tile getTile(int x, int y)
      Returns the Tile object at a certain location, with the bottom left corner of the board defined as (0,0) and the top right defined as (7,7).
      Board.Tile getTile(Location l)
      Returns the Tile object at a certain location, with the bottom left corner of the board defined as (0,0) and the top right defined as (7,7).
      java.util.List<Board.Tile> getTileList() 
      java.util.List<Move> getValidMoves(Game.Color c)
      Gets a list of all valid moves for all pieces of a given color
      boolean isValidMove(Move move)
      Determines whether a given move is valid according to the move's origin piece's defined move set.
      Board performMove(Move move)
      Performs a given move, as well as any additional actions associated with a special move type such as En Passent moves, Castling, and Pawn promotion.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String representation of the board, oriented so the current player is on the bottom, using the Game setting for unicode.

      • getTile

        public Board.Tile getTile(Location l)
        Returns the Tile object at a certain location, with the bottom left corner of the board defined as (0,0) and the top right defined as (7,7).
        Parameters:
        l - The location of the tile to return
        Returns:
        The tile at the specified location

      • getTile

        public Board.Tile getTile(int x,
                 int y)
        Returns the Tile object at a certain location, with the bottom left corner of the board defined as (0,0) and the top right defined as (7,7).
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of the specified Tile
        y - y-coordinate of the specified Tile
        Returns:
        The Tile at the specified location

      • getBoardState

        public Board.Tile[][] getBoardState()
        Returns a two-dimensional array of Tile objects wherein array[0][0] is the top left corner of the board and array[7][7] is the bottom right.
        Returns:
        The array of Tile objects

      • cardinalLineOfSightClear

        public boolean cardinalLineOfSightClear(Location a,
                               Location b)
        Returns whether or not a line of sight between two Locations is 'clear' (has no Pieces between them) in the up, down, left, right directions.
        Parameters:
        a - The first location
        b - The second location
        Returns:
        Whether the cardinal line of sight between two tiles contains no pieces

        Returns:
